divs: Sighting Details About 12:30 am my brother > James,cousin Dwayne,friend Terry and myself traveled > in a truck from Pincher Creek, Alberta to Brocket to > bring Dwayne home to his mother's house(her house is > about 3 kilometers north of the Brocket town > site.There also about 9 homes within a 5 kilometer > radius) . We parked in the driveway (the truck was > facing west) and Dwayne got off. He walked up the > stairs onto the balcony as we backed up he pointed > to the northeast direction. Terry rolled down his > window and he asked Dwayne what he was pointing at. > Dwayne said: "look at those lights over there" we > backed up until we were facing in the north > direction. We then seen a group of lights in the > northeast they were almost above the Head Smashed In > Buffalo Jump site(the Buffalo Jump is about 10 > kilometers northeast of Brocket and about 8 > kilometers northwest of Fort Macleod, Alberta).I > opened the door and i looked between the cab and > door.I thought to myself it must be a > constellation,but i realized i have never seen a > constellation in that area at anytime of the year. > The lights did not make any sound nor appear to move > in any direction. Our reaction to what we were > looking at was very quiet. Then in about two minutes > the group of lights slowly started to dim and fade > away,which took about thirty seconds.
Summary: A group of objects that looked like a constellation that slowly disappeared in the northeast sky .
